column12:
(a) Is the Minister aware that treatment facilities at the Butere/Mumias district hospital are inadequate and cannot cope with the demand for services?

(b) When will she expand the existing facilities from those of a health centre to those of a district hospital?

In view of the upsurge of incidents of insecurity in the country where police officers have put their lives at risk, what measures has the Minister taken to improve police equipment and welfare including remuneration package and insurance scheme?
Could the Minister inform the House how many motorbikes and vehicles have been supplied for agriculture related work to each constituency in the country since 2003?
Could the Minister inform the House how many motorbikes and vehicles have been supplied for agriculture related work to each constituency in the country since 2003?

(a) Could the Minister inform the House when Kibarani School for the Deaf in Bahari Constituency will be furnished with special teaching and learning equipment?

(b) Could he also state what plans he has to fully rehabilitate the school, which has a serious shortage of classrooms and boarding facilities?Could the Minister inform the House how many motorbikes and vehicles have been supplied for agriculture related work to each constituency in the     country since 2003?

(a) Is the Minister aware that water hyacinth has invaded wetlands, streams and other small water bodies thus threatening their survival?

(b) Is he further aware that the weed has also invaded some irrigated lands in Western Kenya, making it expensive to till the fields?

(c) What efforts is the Minister making to eliminate the weed from the affected areas?

(a) Is the Minister aware that Ekero-Ebuyangu road is impassable?

(b) When will the road be tarmacked?

(c) How much has been set aside for that purpose?
What steps is the Minister taking to adjudicate Kabogor-Kipchobet Section?

(a) Is the Minister aware that some farmers in Ahero and West Kano Irrigation Schemes were supplied with uncertified rice seeds during previous seasons?

(b) Is he further aware that the poor quality seeds have affected rice yields in the two schemes?

(c) What action is he taking to ensure that farmers are not supplied with poor quality seeds again?
When will the Minister release the Kiruki Commission Report on the two Armenian brothers which was presented to the President in 2006?

(a) How much money was spent in the construction of the late Dedan Kimathi monument in Nairobi?

(b) How much has the Government given to the family of the late freedom fighter since independence?

(c) What plans does the Government have to compensate freedom fighters in the country?

(a) Could the Minister explain why Mrs. Grace Dhahabu Kazungu, wife of Mr. Julius Kazungu (deceased), a former employee of the Ministry, has not been paid the balance of her workmenâ€™s compensation claim amounting to Kshs.100,000?

(b) When will she be paid?

(a) Is the Minister aware that the Constitution prescribes the minimum and maximum number of constituencies into which the country is divided?

(b) Is the Minister further aware that the Electoral Commission of Kenya is required to review the number, names and boundaries of constituencies at intervals of not less than eight and not more than ten years?

(c) Is she also aware that the review of names, numbers and boundaries of constituencies was last undertaken in 1996 and as a result the Electoral Commission is in breach of the Constitution?

(d) When will the Minister introduce to the House a Bill for an Act of Parliament to increase the number of constituencies to address population growth and other changes that have taken place since the last review?

(a) How many public dips are operational in Samburu district?

(b) Could the Minister re-introduce subsidized dipping infrastructure in the interest of the public and overseas markets?
Why did the Minister discontinue a grant of Kshs.500,000 per annum to Wamba Catholic Mission Hospital which serves thousands of residents of northern Kenya?
Could the Minister consider establishing an Anti Stock Theft Unit at Mbukoi near Marti and upgrade Baragoi and Nyiro Police Posts to Police Stations?
When will the Minister establish a drought contingency fund to finance early warning systems and drought mitigation programmes?

(a) What measures is the Minister putting in place to ensure the survival of Uaso Nyiro River, which is drying up because of massive agricultural activities in the catchment areas?

(b) Is the Minister aware of the impact this will have on pastoralists who depend on the river?

(a) Is the Minister aware of the stalled bus park project at Maralal Town Council?

(b) What is the value of the contract?

(a) Is the Minister aware that Malaba Town Council is illegally collecting land rates from its residents?

(b) Who authorized the Council to collect the said rates?

(a) Why has the Ministry not approved the low-cost housing technology invented by a Kenyan, Mr. John Dumas Gachara?

(b) Is the Minister aware that already the African Regional Intellectual Property Organization (ARIPO) has approved this technology?

(c) How many inventions by Kenyans have been processed and approved by the Ministry since independence?

(a) Is the Minister aware that children with disabilities in special schools are paying for their primary school education?

(b) Could the Minister indicate which special schools are run by the government in each province?

(a) How much bursary money has been set aside during the financial year 2006/2007 for technical institutions?

(b) How much money did the government collect during the 2005/2006 financial year as training levy from various institutions in the country and how was it distributed to various beneficiaries?

Under what circumstances did the Police use live ammunition during the public rallies in Kisumu on 29th October, 2005 and in Mombasa on 11th November, 2005 which resulted into loss of lives and serious injuries to     members of the public?

1. Is the Minister aware that erection of bumps on classified roads contravenes International Highway Code?


  1. Could the Minister order the immediate removal of bumps on all class A, B, and C roads as they are a danger to the motorists and cause damage to motor vehicles?


  1. Could the Minister further ensure that proper signs and signals are the only acceptable mode of controlling vehicular traffic in the country?
